content.prompt: In the Middle Ages, Chartres Cathedral drew many visitors, primarily because it

choices.label: housed an important relic of the Virgin Mary in its crypt
was the place where medieval French kings were buried
displayed a tapestry of Bishop Odo that told the narrative of a famous event
was built on the site where an important biblical event was thought to have occurred

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe contextual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. function.  b. context.  c. siting or physical context.  d. subject matter.  e. reception.
